org.codeseed.common.config.ext

Class CommandLinePropertySource

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.codeseed.common.config.ext.CommandLinePropertySource
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PropertySource

    public class CommandLinePropertySource
extends Object
implements PropertySource
    A property source that exposes command line arguments.

    This property source requires Apache Commons CLI.

    Author:
    Jeremy Gustie

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      CommandLinePropertySource(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine commandLine)
      Creates a new property source from the parsed command line arguments.

      Creates a new property source from the parsed command line arguments.

      Returns a property value or null if no such property is defined.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CommandLinePropertySource

        public CommandLinePropertySource(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine commandLine,
                                 com.google.common.base.Joiner argumentJoiner,
                                 com.google.common.base.Joiner.MapJoiner propertyJoiner)
        Creates a new property source from the parsed command line arguments. The supplied joiners are used to combine option values.
        Parameters:
        commandLine - parsed command line arguments
        argumentJoiner - joiner used on multiple command line arguments when the configuration method returns a sub-type of Iterable
        propertyJoiner - joiner used when the configuration method returns a sub-type of Map

      • CommandLinePropertySource

        public CommandLinePropertySource(org.apache.commons.cli.CommandLine commandLine)
        Creates a new property source from the parsed command line arguments. Options with multiple values will be ',' delimited; options representing maps will be ',' delimited with '=' key/value pairs.
        Parameters:
        commandLine - parsed command line arguments

    • Method Detail

      • getProperty

        public String getProperty(Method method)
        Description copied from interface: PropertySource
        Returns a property value or null if no such property is defined. Properties are looked up using the method from the configuration interface on which they are defined: this allows the lookup mechanism to consider things like the method name, annotation values or the name and/or package of the declaring class.
        Specified by:
        getProperty in interface PropertySource
        Parameters:
        method - the configuration method to look up
        Returns:
        property value, null if undefined

      • triggers

        protected String[] triggers(Method method)
        Returns the list of option triggers associated with the supplied method. By default, this is just the values of the @CommandLine annotation or the method name.
        Parameters:
        method - the configuration method to look up
        Returns:
        the list of command line triggers
